016package com.exoreaction.xorcery.jetty.client.providers;
017
018import com.exoreaction.xorcery.dns.client.providers.DnsLookupService;
019import com.exoreaction.xorcery.dns.client.api.DnsLookup;
020import org.eclipse.jetty.util.Promise;
021import org.eclipse.jetty.util.SocketAddressResolver;
022
023import java.net.InetAddress;
024import java.net.InetSocketAddress;
025import java.net.URI;
026import java.net.URISyntaxException;
027import java.security.SecureRandom;
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Random;
031
032/**
033 * Use the Xorcery DNS lookup service to resolve names.
034 * Apart from normal DNS lookups this would also include manually configured nameservers, multicast discoveries, and mappings in the Configuration.
035 */
036public class DnsLookupSocketAddressResolver
037        implements SocketAddressResolver {
038    private final DnsLookup dnsLookup;
039
040    private final Random random;
041
042    public DnsLookupSocketAddressResolver(DnsLookupService dnsLookup) {
043        this.dnsLookup = dnsLookup;
044        random = new Random();
045    }
046
047    @Override
048    public void resolve(String host, int port, Promise<List<InetSocketAddress>> promise) {
049
050        try {
051            dnsLookup.resolve(new URI("http", null, host, port, null, null, null))
052                    .whenComplete((list, t) ->
053                    {
054                        if (t != null) {
055                            promise.failed(t);
056                        } else {
057                            try {
058                                // Randomly shift the list so that different clients see different orders of IPs
059                                int size = list.size();
060                                List<InetSocketAddress> addressList = new ArrayList<>(size);
061                                int shift = random.nextInt(size);
062                                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
063                                    URI uri = list.get((i+shift)%size);
064                                    InetAddress inetAddress = InetAddress.getByAddress(host, InetAddress.getByName(uri.getHost()).getAddress());
065                                    addressList.add(new InetSocketAddress(inetAddress, uri.getPort()));
066                                }
067                                promise.succeeded(addressList);
068                            } catch (Exception e) {
069                                promise.failed(e);
070                            }
071                        }
072                    });
073        } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
074            promise.failed(e);
075        }
076    }
077}
